sen.j: 大宮通（おおみやどおり）は、京都市の主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Omiya-dori Street is one of the major north- south running streets of Kyoto City.
The Omiya-dori Street is one of the major streets running north-south in Kyoto City.
The Omiya-dori Street is one of the major streets running north-south in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の大宮大路に当たる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Omiya-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Omiya-oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Omiya-oji Street of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 北は竹殿北通から南は久世橋通まで、
sen.e: It runs from the Takedonokita-dori Street in the north to the Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south.
It runs from the Takedonokita-dori Street in the north to the Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south.
It runs from the Takedonokita-dori Street in the north to the Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south.

sen.j: 竹屋町通と押小路通の間で二条城によってとぎれている。
sen.e: Nijo Castle interrupts the street between the Takeyamachi-dori Street and the Oshikoji-dori Street.
Nijo Castle interrupts the street between the Takeyamachi-dori Street and the Oshikoji-dori Street.
Nijo-jo Castle interrupts the street between the Takeyamachi-dori Street and the Oshikoji-dori Street.

sen.j: 所司代屋敷の拡築で丸太町通と竹屋町通間が閉塞された。
sen.e: The extension of the residence of Shoshidai (local governor) interrupted the street between the Marutamachi-dori Street and the Marutamachi-dori Street.
The extension of the Shoshidai (local governor) residence interrupted the street between the Marutamachi-dori Street and the Marutamachi-dori Street.
The extension of the Shoshidai (local governor) residence interrupted the street between the Marutamachi-dori Street and the Takeyamachi-dori Street.

sen.j: 現在、四条通から十条通までは幹線道路となっているが、四条大宮から北は狭くなる。
sen.e: Today's Omiya-dori Street between the Shijo-dori Street and the Jujo-dori Street is an arterial highway, but the section north of Shijo Omiya is narrower.
Today's Omiya-dori Street between Shijo-dori Street and Jujo-dori Street is an arterial highway, but the section north of Shijo Omiya is narrower.
Today's Omiya-dori Street between Shijo-dori Street and Jujo-dori Street is an arterial highway, but the section north of Shijo Omiya is narrower.

sen.j: 四条大宮から北への幹線道路は、京都市内では珍しく斜めを走る後院通を通じて、千本通の千本三条へつながっている。
sen.e: North of Shijo Omiya, the route of arterial highway goes to Sembon-sanjo of the Sembon-dori Street via the Koin-dori Street, an diagonal road uncommon in Kyoto.
North of Shijo Omiya, the primary highway goes to Sembon-sanjo of Sembon-dori Street via the Koin-dori Street, a diagonal road uncommon in Kyoto.
North of Shijo Omiya, the primary highway goes to Senbon-sanjo of Senbon-dori Street via the Koin-dori Street, a diagonal road uncommon in Kyoto.

sen.j: これは、京都市電の南北方向の路線である大宮線、千本線（1972年廃止）の経路によるもの。
sen.e: This is because a north-south line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar, Omiya-seen and Sembon-sen (abolished in 1972) took this route.
sen.cmt: 京都市電 定訳不明
sen.e: This is because the north-south line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar, Omiya-seen and Sembon-sen (abolished in 1972) takes this route.
This is because the north-south line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar, Omiya-sen and Senbon-sen (abolished in 1972) takes this route.

sen.j: 上立売通から元誓願寺通にかけて西陣織の機業地の中心を通る。
sen.e: The street between the Kamidachiuri-dori Street and the Motoseiganji-dori Street runs through the central place of Nishijin brocade weaving or textile industry.
The street between Kamidachiuri-dori Street and Motoseiganji-dori Street runs through the central area of the Nishijin brocade weaving or textile industry.
The street between Kamidachiuri-dori Street and Motoseiganji-dori Street runs through the central area of the Nishijin brocade weaving or textile industry.

sen.j: 「大内裏」の東側に接していたため（ちなみに大内裏の西側に接していた通りを「西大宮大路」といった）と言われているが、この通りの真北の北区紫竹下竹殿町には式内社「久我神社」がありかつて「大宮」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: The street is said to have been given the name of "Omiya" because it borders the eastern edge of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) (incidentally the street bordering the west edge of Dai-dairi was named Nishiomiya-oji Street.), but the former name of Kuga-jinja Shrine of Shikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws), located directly north of the street in Shichiku-Shimotakedono-cho, Kita Ward, was "Omiya."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処http://www.mutsunohana.net/miyako/oji-koji/nishiomiya-oji.htmhttp://www.excite.co.jp/map/address/26/101/http://kaiwai.city.kyoto.jp/search/view_sight.php?ManageCode=1000300&InforKindCode=1&whole=truehttp://spysee.jp/大宮
sen.e: The street is said to have been given the name of "Omiya" because it borders the eastern edge of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) (incidentally the street bordering the west edge of Dai-dairi was named Nishiomiya-oji Street.), but the former name of Kuga-jinja Shrine of Shikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws), located directly north of the street in Shichiku-Shimotakedono-cho, Kita Ward, was "Omiya."

The street is said to have been given the name of 'Omiya' because it borders the eastern edge of Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) (incidentally the street bordering the west edge of Dai-dairi was named Nishiomiya-oji Street), but the former name of Kuga-jinja Shrine of Shikinaisha (shrine listed in Engishiki laws), located directly north of the street in Shichiku-Shimotakedono-cho, Kita Ward, was 'Omiya.'
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に文中ピリオド削除

sen.j: この地はかつて「大宮郷」と呼ばれ、カモ族が京都盆地に最初に居を定めた位置とも言われる。
sen.e: This district was once named "Omiyago" and is said to the first place for kamozoku (people those lived Kyoto basin to farm in Yayoi are) to settle in. There is an explanation that Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine originated here. (A ship crossing the river from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine to the right bank was once called Omiya Ferry.)

This district was once named "Omiyago" and is said to be the first place where kamozoku (people those lived Kyoto basin to farm in Yayoi are) settled in. There is an explanation that Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine originated here. (A ship crossing the river from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine to the right bank was once called Omiya Ferry.)
This district was once named 'Omiyago' and is said to be the first place where kamozoku (people those lived Kyoto basin to farm in Yayoi are) settled in.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'に一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 賀茂別雷神社の旧地との説もある（上賀茂神社から賀茂川右岸側への渡しはかつて「大宮渡し」と呼ばれた）。
sen.e: There is an explanation that Kamo-wakeikazuchi-jinja Shrine originated here. (A ship crossing the river from Kamigamo-jinja Shrine to the right bank was once called Omiya Ferry.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 従って「大宮」は平安京以前から存在し「大宮通」命名の由来としても不都合はない。
sen.e: Therefore "Omiya"may have existed before the construction of Heiankyo, and it may not be wrong that the name of "Omiya-dor"comes from this shrine. Or "Omiya" can serve as the datum line for the construction of Heiankyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore "Omiya"may have existed before the construction of Heiankyo, and it may not be wrong that the name of "Omiya-dor"comes from this shrine. Or "Omiya" can serve as the datum line for the construction of Heiankyo.
Therefore 'Omiya' may have existed before the construction of Heiankyo, and it may not be wrong that the name of 'Omiya-dori' comes from this shrine.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合わせ"を'にスペース挿入一原文一訳文例外対処スペルを修正

sen.j: あるいは平安京建設時の基準線となった可能性もある。
sen.e: Or 'Omiya' can serve as the datum line for the construction of Heiankyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: ここでは、四条大宮からの幹線道路について記述する。
sen.e: Here below described is the arterial highway section from Sijo-Omiya.

sen.j: 交差する道路の特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.

sen.j: 尚、現在の大宮通りは久世橋通りより南に延長されており、伏見区上鳥羽近辺の鴨川を超えた南岸のところで油小路通りと交差している。
sen.e: In addition, today's Omiya-dori Street is extended southward from the Kuzebashi-dori Street, until it crosses the Kamogawa River and intersects with the Abura-no-koji dori Street at the southern bank of the River near Kamitoba, Minami Ward.
sen.cmt: http://web.kyoto-inet.or.jp/people/kurituka/torina.htm「上鳥羽」という地名が伏見区に見当たらず、地図で確認した結果、「南区上鳥羽」と訳出しました。
sen.e: In addition, today's Omiya-dori Street is extended southward from the Kuzebashi-dori Street, until crossing the Kamogawa River and intersecting with the Abura-no-koji dori Street at the southern bank of the River near Kamitoba, Minami Ward.

In addition, today's Omiya-dori Street is extended southward from the Kuzebashi-dori Street, until crossing the Kamogawa River and intersecting with the Abura-no-koji dori Street at the southern bank of the River near Kamitoba, Fushimi Ward.

sen.j: 毛吹草(松江重頼編、1645年)の記実によると、江戸時代初期の京都の名産品が数多く書かれている。
sen.e: Kefukigusa (haiku book) (compiled by Shigeyori MATSUE in 1645) describes many specialties of Kyoto in the early Edo era.

sen.j: 京都を含む山城国の項では、京の町の北から南へ、また西から東へ、通りの順を追って地域ごと物産品が列挙されている。
sen.e: The section of Yamashiro-no-kuni, which includes Kyoto, lists products of every region according to the street of Kyo (capital) from north to south and from east to west.

sen.j: (300種以上、京の多職種の職人と多品種の物産の存在をうかがわせてくれる。)
sen.e: (It reveals that there were craftsmen in a wide variety of fields and products of more than 300 kinds in Kyo.)
(It reveals that there were a wide variety of craftsmen across many different fields and products totaling over 300 kinds in the Kyo.)
(It reveals that there were a wide variety of craftsmen across many different fields and products totaling over 300 kinds in the Kyo.)

sen.j: 大宮通り 葡萄(当所に多作出す)
sen.e: Omiya-dori Street, grapes (good harvests there)
Omiya-dori Street, grapes (good harvests there)
Omiya-dori Street, grapes (good harvests there)

sen.j: 当時京都の大宮通りで栽培されていた葡萄は、大宮葡萄と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: In those days the grapes grown in the district along the Omiya-dori Street were originally called Omiya grape.
In those days the grapes grown in the district along the Omiya-dori Street were originally called Omiya grape.
In those days the grapes grown in the district along the Omiya-dori Street were originally called Omiya grape.

sen.j: その大宮葡萄の棚掛栽培法が秀吉の築いた聚楽第跡や伏見城で発見され、葡萄棚掛栽培でできた葡萄を聚楽葡萄と呼ばれる様になった。
sen.e: After study of Hideyoshi-built Jurakudai-ato (remains of Jurakudai) and Fushimi castle discovered that Omiya grape vine were grown using a trellis, such grapes produced on a trellis began to be called Juraku Budo Grape.

After an investigation into the Hideyoshi-built Jurakudai-ato (remains of Jurakudai) and Fushimi castle discovered that Omiya grape vine were grown using a trellis, such grapes produced on a trellis began to be called Juraku Budo Grape.

After an investigation into the Hideyoshi-built Jurakudai-ato (remains of Jurakudai) and Fushimi-jo Castle discovered that Omiya grape vine were grown using a trellis, such grapes produced on a trellis began to be called Juraku Budo Grape.

sen.j: 桃山時代の葡萄棚図屏風に葡萄棚の意匠が残されている。
sen.e: Grape Vine Trellis, a folding screen of the Momoyama era, depicts the design of the grape vine trellis.
Grape Vine Trellis, a folding screen of the Momoyama era, depicts the design of the grape vine trellis.
Grape Vine Trellis, a folding screen of the Momoyama period, depicts the design of the grape vine trellis.
